title: Model, 16, 'attacked and kicked in head' outside nightclub 'for being pretty'
text:

A teenage model was kicked in the head and attacked by a "jealous" woman on a night out because "she is a pretty girl", her mum claims.

Jacee Pink, 16, was left bloodied, bruised and suffering from the effects of a concussion after she was allegedly dragged around and kicked while she was on the floor.

The Sunderland teen claimed she was going out for a meal with friends, but secretly went to a city centre nightclub, her mum Amy Pink says.

Amid an ugly row on Facebook, Amy claims men have since been calling her up to threaten her and ask "where do you f***ing live?", ChronicleLive reports.

(Image: ChronicleLive)

Aspiring singer Jacee, who lost some of her fingernails, was hospitalised and under went scans after she was assaulted near Passion nightclub in the early hours of Sunday morning, her mum said.

However, a woman defended herself on Facebook, writing that she "knocked into" someone she thought was an adult and "not a 16-year-old that should of been in bed" (sic) and "we ended up fighting and she pulled me to the floor by my hair".

The woman claimed she had a bite mark on her chest and the teen "gave as good as she got" during the fight, adding: "I payed 320 for a weeve in yesterday and shes ripped it out my head." (sic)

(Image: ChronicleLive)

Mum Amy claimed: "Jacee was at the bar, then all of a sudden the woman was pushing, grabbing and then kicking her while she was on the floor.

"She's been kicked in the head a few times and has been very dizzy. She's frightened and she is only still a child.

"She was crying afterwards and asked 'why have I been targeted?'. She is a pretty girl and feels targeted because of that.

"Nobody knows what has happened but I think it is has been instigated through jealousy, it is completely unprovoked and it has to all be down to jealousy."

(Image: ChronicleLive)

Amy claims that "jealousy" may be down to her daughter's singing and modelling.

One YouTube clip featuring the teen - a music video for the charity song Paint the Night Pink in support of Breast Cancer UK - has had almost 20,000 views since July 2017.

Jacee has also competed in a number of local talent shows.

Amy has faced criticism on social media about her daughter going to a nightclub at just 16.

The woman who wrote that she was involved in the fight added in one Facebook post: "I have two daughters and at least I no where they are on a night!" (sic)

(Image: ChronicleLive)

Northumbria Police are investigating the alleged incident and the nightclub said it is carrying out its own investigation.

The Pink family has shared photos of the injuries Jacee suffered in what Amy described as a "horrible, nasty attack".

The mum claimed: "There's been horrible Facebook messages sent to us and I've had men calling up threatening us.

"They were asking 'where do you f***ing live?' - but I just thought these people must be idiots."

Amy said Jacee told her that she was going out for a meal with friends on Saturday night, but she had secretly been planning a night out at a club.

The mum added: "I'd done it myself when I was her age, I'd tell my dad I was going to Pizza Hut then I'd be in the pubs and clubs.

"But normally she is good and responsible and I had no issue with what she's done, just what happened to her.

"She doesn't deserve this and I hope the police charge someone for what has happened."

A spokesperson for Northumbria Police said: "Shortly after 4pm on Sunday, police received a report of an assault near Passion nightclub in Sunderland.

"The assault is believed to have happened around midnight on Saturday and reported to police the following day.

"It was reported that a woman assaulted a 16-year-old teenager who was then taken to hospital with a suspected concussion."
description: Jacee Pink, 16, was left bloodied, bruised and suffering from a concussion after she was dragged and kicked, her mum claims
